resources.string: Are you sure you want to reboot?
Are you sure you want to perform a soft reboot?
Are you sure you want to reboot to recovery?
Are you sure you want to reboot to bootloader?
Are you sure you want to reboot to download mode?
Are you sure you want to power off?

An old version of this app was found on the device. Do you want to remove it and reboot? You can disable this message from the settings, if you want to keep both. Note that the device will reboot to complete the process.
Show a confirmation dialog before rebooting or powering off
Show or hide \"Reboot to recovery\" button
Show or hide \"Reboot to bootloader\" button
Show or hide \"Reboot to download mode\" button
WARNING : Selecting \"no\" on iMito QX1 is likely to cause a bootloop. Use at your own risk!
Use \"misc image\" trick to reboot to recovery
On many rockchip and allwinner devices, some text has to be written to the \"misc\" partition to reboot to recovery. Try to force it to \"yes\" if you can\'t reboot to recovery.
Try to remount FileSystem read-only before rebooting
Enabling this option can prevent FileSystem corruption, but can freeze the system.
Check for an old version of the application, and offer to remove it
If you don\'t remove the old version of the reboot application (before 1.4.0), you will have both on your device, so this new version can remove the old one.
Execute root commands in main thread
Disabled by default for better responsiveness. Try to check this option if you have problems.
